} } } Length:: 0:24 MinsI see a few people have had leaks. The on-screen camera instructions make you aware there "might" be a problem. (They scare you to death as a matter of fact.)I use this WET where there is lots of dirt, sand, etc.NEVER more than an arms length under water. Snorkeling, swimming, etc.(NO jumping in water, that is abuse IMHO...)Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS2 14.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 4.6x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue)I've had 4 other (up to 33 ft) underwater cameras and half of them leaked.Olympus was the best about fixing it. NO questions asked. (I bought the Olympus extended warranty and it was worth every penny and they honored it fully.My FujiFilm never leaked enough early on to cause problems.BUT that one made me go BACK TO what professionals do. (NOW it no longer leaks.)(I had a couple REAL underwater models also.)IF you get this one, (the TS2 is the BEST of the lot) get some real diving silicon and LIGHTLY coat the seals AND the surfaces the seals touch.(I use Trident #LP20 Pure Silicon Grease 2 OZ package.)This is what professionals do with *REAL* underwater cameras.(NOTE: LIGHTLY means that you DO NOT put on enough that it picks up dirt, sand, etc. LIGHTLY means you can barely tell it is there...)I can NOT see ANY currently, so I guess I need a new VERY LIGHT application.The seals are VERY small, and need this MORE than the better professional models.I got a truly LIFETIME supply at a Dive Shop in the USVI for $10(US), so protecting a (currently?) $400 camera this way seems like a no-brainer.I NEVER connect this (or any camera) to my computer. I "card-net" the pictures with a card reader.That lets me leave the smaller door closed "forever". It is harder to clean fully and gets dirty easier near the hinge.EDIT: Got the newer model.Additional: NEVER touch the front glass where the lens is.The coating scratches easily. Some very small sand must havegotten on mine and I should have tried to rinse it off with water.*I dropped the older camera and was unluckyenough to "ding" the glass lens cover slightly*......I got the newer model, the TS3 and it is a littlecheaper, one door instead of two (and not as strong a door), but it worksVERY well and has not leaked. I still use the diving silicone paste/grease.Video quality is excellent in AVCHD Mode, and files are smaller.I edit them with "freemake' video converter.

Reviews.Title: Maui trip
Reviews.Author: HarleyChick
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our trip to maui..we went snorkling,road to hana,luau,molokini,turtle town...beaches you name it...I really am happy with this camera ..it took awesome underwater pictures...it did fog up when we were on the road to hana..it was raining hard and very humid..i put the camera up the heater vent and it dried up right away.. another thing that happened was we went to 2 snorkeling spots..the camera stopped taking pictures after being in the water for over an hour..it just froze up...which it says there is a limit of 60 minutes for under water use...I cleaned it, charged the battery overnight and let it dry out...it worked fine the next morning :o) I did my research on these underwater cameras before buying and I am very happy with this choice ...this one will go 33ft..but you can also buy a case for it and take it down to 150ft ...if you go down that deep....also bought a transcend 32gb schc class 6 card with usb reader ..works great

Reviews.Title: HD + Waterproofing!
Reviews.Author: Psychology Major
Reviews.Content: Well, it's still got a ways to go but I like it...I've owned 2 previous digital waterproof cameras before and they both needed improvement.  I buy underwater cameras for the main purpose of going underwater & taking photos or video.  First was the Olympus waterproof to 15 feet and the next one was the Olympus 770SW = essentially the same but you can go deeper underwater.  Both of these excelled at being able to fit in a pair of board shorts and looked really sleek.  However, they lacked a LOT.  It had a lot of lag time between shots and the shots were mostly blurry underwater.  The color was off and it wasn't that easy to switch between macro & wide modes.  It was even more difficult to take a video when the opportunity arose.Enough about the Junk of the past,  Let's go over the Lumix.  The Lumix has many advantages to the older Olympus.  It shoots in HD and the pictures are Huge!  It's really easy to use; even underwater, especially due to the iAuto mode which adjusts things for you.  The color sometimes needs some correction after the shot and you can use any digital photo program to fix this, but it gets a bit tedious.  I like that it fits in my pocket and the seal has a lock, so you know it's sealed tight.  It comes w/ instructions on how to keep water from getting inside the camera.  I haven't ever had a camera where the Sunset mode does much of anything, but with this one it works like a charm.  Also it's nice to use the lock focus mode, in where you can lock onto an object in your picture, then move the camera around until you get the framing right.  It's a bit difficult to understand, but when you see it you'll love it.  Oh, last thing I can remember is the flash has an interesting feature of highlighting your shot in the dark w/ a really bright LED light to get the aperture settings correct before you shoot.Overall, it's a step up from what I had before.  Also, it's one of the best reviewed cameras.I give it one less star for the coloring of my pictures being a bit off.

Reviews.Title: great camera, bad software
Reviews.Author: T
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  Really easy, great picture and video w/ sound quality.  Leaving it in the auto setting worked really good.  Of course I like more control so I changed the settings many times.  Its easy to make the changes and then back to auto for the no brainer picture taking.  This camera spent a lot of time under water, in the ocean, on the sand, in the middle of waves.  It withstood it all.  Sometimes its a bit difficult to get the tiny fine bits of sand off from around the rubber gaskets.  The silicone cover keeps the finish from getting scratched and gave me extra peace of mind that I or some rogue sea critter won't some how accidentally open the battery door while under water.The play back screen is big and bright.  Its super easy to record movies.  The sound is pretty good too.  It picked up some faint little sounds that I was surprised to hear on playback.The software that it comes with, I don't like.  The editing features are good but its not very easy to use.  Or maybe its just too different from what I usually use.  Good thing that I can use other software that I do like after downloading the pics to my pc.The battery recharges pretty fast.I bought a few accessories to go w/ this camera also.  A floaty strap is important since this camera does not float.  The orange Olympus floaty strap brought my camera back to the surface in both fresh water river and ocean.I also highly recommend buying a good memory card.  This is not where you go cheapo.Overall, this is a great camera for casual every day use and, the artsy fartsy photographer can have a lot of fun with it too, like me.

Reviews.Title: NOT WATERPROOF!
Reviews.Author: Brian Ski
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maui.  Took it snorkling down to 15 ft and inner lens fogged up afterward.  Water also inside battery compartment. 1st time I used it.  Made sure nothing was prohibiting the seal, but still leaked.  Sad. Also the lens gets dirty and scratched really fast (no cover from elements at all, always exposed.) Picture quality wasn't as good as my Nikon Coolpix.  It seemed like some of the pictures were decent and then others were really grainy like it switched to 2 megapixels or soething.  Colors are not natural, especially grass.

Reviews.Title: Great P&S; camera, love it
Reviews.Author: Bryon Studer
Reviews.Content: We bought this P&S; as a replacement for a Canon that was left in the rain over night.  This camera doesn't have the zoom our old one did, but it works well.  Great picture and video quality.  We used it on a vacation to Dollywood and Splash Country in TN.  Worked great, it was wonderful to carry a camera and NOT have to worry about it getting wet or banging it into a ride.  We captured our day at the water park, took pics and video all day.  Battery life is quite good as well and can easily get an entire day of shooting.  All that was expected.  I read other reviews, and choose this camera over the Olymus...because of the picture quality.  What surprised me was how well it did on landscapes and especially things like sunsets.  The AI mode does very well.  Overall very satisfied, could be a brighter lens, could have longer zoom...but for what it is...a bullet proof, water tight, easy to use pocket camera, we really like it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good overall
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Peterman
Reviews.Content: When I first got this camera, I did extensive testing and viewed the images carefully, and wasn't happy with the image quality - too much noise/loss of detail from noise reduction and was planning to return it. Then my Canon SD800 returned from a trip and I did detailed comparisons of the images from both under a range of conditions. The Panasonic images were better. As I was reasonably happy with the SD800, and the Panasonic adds a longer lens, MUCH better video, ruggedness, and under water capability. I guess I was looking too closely (owning several DSLRs) and it is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but case corrodes badly
Reviews.Author: Ian
Reviews.Content: I bought this three months ago to replace a five-year old Olympus waterproof, because I liked the quality of video the Lumix produced. I use it sea kayaking, so it's in a saltwater immersion environment. I've been pretty rigorous about rinsing the unit after use. Nevertheless there has been an astonishing amount of corrosion occur in the aluminium case, to the point that I think its days are numbered. I recently went on a six-day kayak trip and a friend who had the same camera, just a few months older, found hers failed due to corrosion on the  button contacts.I have seen several other of these cameras that have had the same problem - two to my personal knowledge that have failed. I don't know whether the users were religious about rinsing them, but I have certainly not experienced this rapid corrosion before.I am scrupulous now about rinsing this but even so I can see that corrosion on the back plate around the control buttons has increased. I'm often on the water for three or four hours so there's no way I can keep it away from salt water in that period. A chemistry professor friend speculates that there are manufacturing options that could limit the electrical reactivity of the aluminium case but choosing to use an aluminium case in a saltwater environment is always going to be dodgy because of the intrinsic highly reactive nature of the metal. It's not as if you can attach a sacrifical anode!All in all, I was very pleased with the image quality and ease of use once I got rid of the nag screen, but the exterior case means I can't regard it as fit for purpose. It may satisfy some standards criteria but the exterior case corrosion means it's not  a great option out in the real world.

Reviews.Title: Very good, portable, underwater camera
Reviews.Author: MTV
Reviews.Content: I, like many of you, researched cameras that could be brought in the water and could withstand the rigors of frequent and sometimes violent travel.  After much debate, I selected the Panasonic Lumix TS2 based on the picture quality and the ability to go 30+ feet underwater for shallow dives.  I really didn't want a huge camera that would effect my underwater mobility.  Other cameras in this class could only go under 10ft, which is fine for snorkeling, but not for diving.I took the camera on a test run to Mexico and took it snorkeling first, then diving to 30ft twice (salt water).  I was able to take very good photos and the HD videos turned out great.  To finally be able to share videos in HD of diving with my friends and family was really a neat experience.  The microphone worked underwater as well and the water sounds added a funny, if unnecessary, twist.I have read a few reviews about other folks losing their TS2 to water damage and I was very careful when closing the battery/memory card case.  A brush is included to help clean out the compartment as even grains of sand can lead to water entry.  The camera has had no problems in water.  I checked my diving gauge and (hesitantly) brought the camera to exactly 30ft deep.  I maintained this depth twice on two separate dives for 15 minutes each time with no problems.Battery life and memory card space are directly dependent on how much HD video you take.  For just photos, the battery life is normal to above average.The photo quality is very good but not fantastic.  Comparing this to an SLR is unfair, however the macro and still photos were good. It was difficult to get the elusive sea life while in motion in low light, however in full light the photos were very good. The flash, although not very bright, worked underwater for macro shots and helps with capturing the color of some coral.I'm not a diving pro, maybe 3-4 times a year, and I am an average to above average photgrapher.  This camera worked very well for my needs.  Hope that helps.

Reviews.Title: great waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Ryan "blarneyrock"
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in Honduras, first real world test of this camera, and it performed excellently.  Found the camera overall pretty easy to use, I didn't dive into some of the more specific technical settings, but found it to be pretty easy to use without the manual. (to get the full manual you have to print a pdf file from a provided disc, seems a little cheap but more and more companies are doing this) Underwater this camera worked great, I lived in the water with this thing, hours at a time in the ocean and pool, and also took it snorkeling. I followed the care instructions for the seals, always washed my hands before sealing to ensure I had no lotions or grease on my hands and never had an issue with water. I had been a little worried after reading some reviews of people's problems in the water, but I have to believe those seals were defective or the users were careless because I had this thing underwater hours each day for a week without a single issue. Picture quality seems good, prob can buy a camera around the same price that takes a little better pics, but not with the overall ruggedness and underwater capabilities of this. It is a little heavy due to the spills it can withstand, but I carried it in my pocket all day without an issue. Buy it and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Serves its purpose well
Reviews.Author: stan the man
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, I was looking for a rugged camera to take underwater/beach or on that ski trip where I would  not worry about the camera. I did my research and like many have said it came down to the Panasonic and Canon and I chose the Panasonic because it was more portable and also because I currently love recording video of the family in HD using my sony camcorder that uses AVCHD which this Pansonic does too.I recently got to test this camera out on a family trip to the Maldives. Took this camera out snorkeling and to the pool over a half dozen times and had it rolling around in the sand with me and the kids. I took some pictures which came out good but my wife also brought along our Canon SD1000 whose pictures were extremely comparable. The pictures on the canon are probably actually slightly better in my opinion except that it can't take underwater pictures of the kids or the fish (unless I got a shell which I find too bulky to lug around). The true value was the video which was awesome. Now, it is not easy to record video underwater while snorkeling because glare off the screen was tough to get used to underwater, but once I adapted I have great footage of parrot fish, angel fish and even black tipped reef sharks that swim up to you. I have my son and wife pointing out at the coral and schools of fish swimming up to them. Truly once in a lifetime and this camera performed.Once we got back home from vacation, it snowed and with the kids, we went out for a good old snow ball fight which this camera recorded and even took a nice direct hit.So in summary, the pictures on this camera are OK and the video is great. The ruggedness and waterproof is what you want and this passes with flying color (even took a big licking on coral and came away with minor scratches). Also this was very portable and only slightly noticeably bigger than our Canon SD1000. It fit easily in my pocket and I took it everywhere. These are the reasons I bought it and it was definitely money well spend. (also the blue is a cool color to get too and stands out nice)

Reviews.Title: The best camera is the one you have...
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Provencher "ppro"
Reviews.Content: OK, I stole the review title, but the phrase really fits.  Here's why:I have a heavy, prosumer-grade DSLR that makes incredible images.  I love to use it and for the first year and a half of ownership, carried it everywhere along with a tripod, a monopod, four lenses, charger, extra batteries, and all the little gadgets that go with it.  Almost 30 pounds of gear in a purpose-built backpack.  And I have made some very pleasing images.And then my sons started having outdoor activities involving hiking, camping, water, and ice.  As I like to be in the outdoors, I naturally participated and brought my "pack of lead" with me.  Well that was fine for the trips where the weather was nice and I didn't need to carry anything but my camera gear.  But at the end of the day, I was whipped and I had to be concerned with securing my DSLR kit so it would not get wet, cold or in some other way damaged.  Then came the multi-day hikes and activities like Cross-Country skiing...It was clear to me (what took so long you must be saying?) that this was not going to work.  I went on one hike with no camera and spent the whole trip feeling that I was missing photo-opportunities.  It's just the way I am wired.  I have been recording my kids outdoor activities for their entire lives and this left a gap.  I tried to revert to my previous digital camera but it was a bit large and also vunerable to the elements, and a bit dated from the technology point-of-view.  I needed to get a camera that was going to be small, rugged, and capable of producing better than average images.Which brings me to the Lumix DMC-TS2.  I looked at the variety of cameras in this class (waterproof, "drop-proof", freeze-proof, dust-proof) and found that from the choices offered by Canon, Pentax, Fuji, Olympus, and Panasonic, only the Canon and Panasonic had image quality that would rise to the level I needed.  The others are fine cameras and produce good images, but I wanted to get the best image quality possible and have a camera that would withstand some abuse.Comparing the Canon D10 to the Lumix DMC-TS2, I found the Canon to be larger, though just as well qualified to produce great images.  In fact my inclination was to go for the Canon but the size was the determining factor.  The Lumix just fits better in the pocket and on my backpack belt.  The image quality (according to numerous reviews) is a toss-up, so there it was - choice made.In actual practice this camera is quite good, though you will need to spend considerable time with the advanced owners guide to get the most from the camera.  If you just want to point-and-shoot, the camera has a terrific setting for this, along with some basic "scene" presets (snow, beach, underwater, portrait, etc.) that in my experience produce some great pictures.The memory card this camera uses offers storage from a couple giga-bytes to 64 GB.  At 64GB you are paying more for the memory than the camera, but you have a bottomless store for pictures - great if you plan to be on a multi-week outing with no computer access.Which brings me to batteries.  With my DSLR, I use a two-battery grip that gives me about 1000 images between charges.  Panasonic rate these batteries to give about 300 images per charge.  Consequently I recommend, as I have done, to get two or three batteries if you expect to be away from a power source for a few days.  The batteries fit well into any number of small belt-sized camera cases that you may wish to purchase for carrying the camera.The best results I have gotten with this camera to date are sunsets, morning skies, some people shots, and landscapes in general.  There are also some great portrait settings that I just starting to explore with good results.I don't plan to go diving, but am happy that the camera will tolerate it.  I don't plan to drop the camera but it's nice to know this camera will survive small bobbles.  I spent a lot of time outside in bad weather and cold so feel good that this camera is made to do that.  This gives me the solution to that heavy DSLR kit that cannot coexist with outdoor activities.The best camera (for me) is the one I have with me...Here's what I pulled together for my "light-weight expedition kit"Professional Mini Ball Head Camera MountRemington Multi Functional Shooter's RestLowepro Ridge 30 Camera Case (Black)Sony LCSCSQ Soft Carrying Case for Sony T, W, and N Series Digital Cameras (Black)Plano 10137 Gun Guard SE Single Scoped Pistol Case

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, Easy for my 12-yearold son to use
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: All seems fine with this new camera.  We got it for our 12-year-old son who's active and an avid photographer.  The ruggedness of this camera and good reviews led us to purchase it and so far no regrets whatsoever.  No problems in the first month of fairly active use.  No complaints and he seems quite happy with the camera.  I did not rate all 5's just because we haven't had the camera long enough to be sure.  But, it seems to be quite reliable, versatile, and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Just got baqck from the Great Barrier Reef
Reviews.Author: Mr. Awesome
Reviews.Content: I just got back from taking this little camera to the great barrier reef in Cairns, Australia, and I was impressed!  No water made it into the battery/memory area, and it functionaed flawlessly underwater.  When it comes to taking pictures underwater, I want the least fuss possible.  And this camera, when used in the iA mode, took excellent pictures.  Even when zoomed in fully (which is still a measly 3x due to the non-telescoping lense) took stable, clean pictures in 14 MP.My previous camera, a Sony Cybershot, would have to use a tri-pod to take a stable picture when using the zoom.  Which, isn't an option at all underwater.  The Sony also had a 5x zoom, but I think the point stands.  When using the "Normal Picture" mode, the shots again were shaky and blurry, but iA mode handles this much better.I do have to admit, the video taking is NOT intuitive.  You're best off reading the instruction manual before attempting it.  But overall, I was very impressed with this little camera!

Reviews.Title: Kayak Camera- Works Really Well
Reviews.Author: William Gardner
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera back in April ('10) as we wanted a P&S; that we could take out in our sea kayaks. It needed to be waterproof, fairly high quality, and needed to fit in a PFD pocket. This little camera has survived rolls, practice rescues, and about any other way we could get it wet. No problems at all so far, despite our attempts to drown it in both salt and fresh water.A couple of things to keep in mind..... You must keep that gasket for the battery/memory card clean. Carry a soft cloth, your shirt tail (if free of sand and salt), something. Also, this camera does not float. I took a GPS bag (Lowepro 3.5-Inch Navi Handheld GPS Carrying Case (Black)) and filled the battery pouch with high density foam. The camera strap is securely attached to the bag, the bag is securely attached to a PFD.All in all, I would buy this again. While it is not the image quality of my professional gear, I am pleased with the results and I am pleased with how well it has resisted water.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera - perfect for snorkel
Reviews.Author: Katydid "Katy"
Reviews.Content: Originally purchased the TS1 to use when we were in the Galapagos.  I was totally sold on the camera.  The battery would last all day, even with lots of video.  It charged quickly to use again and again.  Now we are getting ready to go to the Great Barrier Reef and misplaced or lost the TS1 while we were home.  I was heartbroken until I decided life was to short to "settle on another camera".  Granted approximately $300 isn't a lot, but it definitely made me think twice.  I can hardly wait to get to the GBR and the reef in New Caldonia to use while we snorkel.  The TS2 seals look more secure and the two setting for underwater will come in handly.  Some of the shots in the Galapagos were a little murky.  Love the small size, fits into my fanny pack without weighting it down.  My husband got one because he was tired of waiting his turn.  We are very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Hardened, tuff and dust proof....but...
Reviews.Author: hikerted
Reviews.Content: The camera does everything it says it will. I bought it as a P&S; that would be impervious to the elements - something that I can casually toss in my backpack or take for a ride w/o worrying about dust or rain getting in to mess with the optics.The only downsides are that1) it doesn't do especially well with inside shots w/flash. Lots of my images turned out blurry or grainy (situations where my other Canon P&S; wouldn't have any problems with).2) the proprietary USB connection on the side of the camera is just that... Special, unique. You better not lose that cable that comes with the camera! I mean, really! Why did Panasonic have to do that? Everyone else in the industry has a "normal" mini-USB connector to hook up the camera to a PC. What were they thinking?I've used this camera on the beach, while kayaking, out in the desert riding bikes and UTV's, backpacking in the rain - and it held up perfectly.

Reviews.Title: A general Panasonic Lumix warning!
Reviews.Author: kmtk24
Reviews.Content: I Purchased the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1 on 02/3/10 along with the Panasonic marine camera case.  One of the main reasons for purchasing the Lumix DMC-TS1 was the "waterproof" camera itself.  I thought in the seemingly rare case that  the marine housing were to leak  the camera itself would be "waterproof".  I thought I had a good back up plan.  However on a shore dive (only the third vacation of using the Panasonic camera and housing), the housing leaked allowing water in the case.  The shore dive was fairly shallow, no greater than 30 feet.When I returned to the resort from the dive, I quickly removed the camera from the housing that was 1/2 full of water.  I rinsed the camera off with tap water to rid the salt water.  I let the camera air out for 24 hours before reassessing.  I expected the camera to turn on, when it failed to turn on I was shocked.  This is the first time the camera ever came in contact with water and it was while it was in the marine housing.  My brother has a Canon that accidently got wet when his housing leaked and it still works, and it is not advertised as being a "waterproof" camera. So I have two failed pieces of equipment from Panasonic each costing over $200 dollars.  It happens to be 3 weeks over the year warranty .  I have the wonderful opportunity of mailing in the defective equipment ( at my cost) and for $45 I can have their technician look at it.  After it has been assessed , a repair fee will be given and thankfully I can apply the $45 dollars to the repair fee.I  have a Sealife camera and marine casing that has never leaked over the years of use.  If you are planning on taking pictures while diving, you might want to consider other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera. But no support from Panasonic or Amazon
Reviews.Author: z_Hunter
Reviews.Content: I bought this back late 2010 and  took it with me on a trip to Costa Rica. Had it in the pool, beach and even zip lining over the rain forest! Beautiful photos and videos.Like other have said. Water spots can be an issue. But that is true of any water proof camera. I use to have a Cannon in a water proof case. And I'd get water spots all the time.Less than a year later. It died. I emailed Panasonic a few times and never got a response back. I tried thru Amazon to see if they could help and never heard back from them either. Very upset that Amazon ignored my email to them about this. Especially given the fact that I pretty much buy everything from them.I gave it 3 stars due to Panasonic not caring. I don't think I'll buy anything from Panasonic again.

Reviews.Title: Undersea Star
Reviews.Author: D. Jensen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Kauai. I also ordered an 8 GB memory card, extra battery, and a floating wriststrap. It all arrived quickly and I took a few pictures before the trip just to make sure everything worked fine, which it did. The 2nd day in Kauai we went on a snorkling tour and the camera worked perfectly. I only took it down to about 12 or 15 feet, but I had no trouble. I took about 150 pictures at full resolution without running out of charge on the battery. Other people have complained about this model camera leaking, and I think that is because they were not meticulous about making sure the rubber gaskets on the 2 covers were free of any sand, hair or dirt. After using it in the ocean, I followed the directions and soaked it in fresh water for ~10 minutes. I put it in a glass bowl, and swished it around. When I emptied the bowl, there was quite a bit of fine sand/silt that came out of the crevices in the camera. I let it drain on a towel for a bit before I opened it up to keep any water from getting in. When I opened the battery/memory cover, there was still some sand/silt around the gasket area, so I used the included brush to make sure it was all clean before I closed it up. It helps if you have some good lighting when you're doing this. Although the water wasn't perfectly clear because of recent heavy rains, I still got some great shots while swimming with Green Sea Turtles. Out of the water the camera worked well too, with the smart mode knowing the diference between shots of people, landscapes and clouds. The small size made it easy to take along, and the slip on silicone cover was handy for a little extra protection on land. I just wish I had thought to buy this camera before I went to Fiji last year, where the water is clearer and the variety of fish is unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: BRIAN
Reviews.Content: Now had this camera for 4 mos and taken numerous pic under a variety of situations.  Choice was btw Canon and the Panasonic.  No regrets on the choice and it will be going to Virgin Islands in May.  I do a fair amount of kayaking and this one fills the bill.  Earlier I bought the Fujifilm XP and the pic quality was not acceptable and on par with the cheap disposable cameras.  Surprising is the Panasonic pic quality at the max magnification.  I have been partial to Canons and now equally impressed with Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a trip to California, but didn't get to go.  Brought it on a trip to Florida, great pictures while in the ocean.  Loved being able to take pictures while on the water rides in Disney.  Love this camera; great buy.

Reviews.Title: Good choice
Reviews.Author: jamie
Reviews.Content: We bought the camera for Christmas, and have had it is the swimming pool a couple of times and am amazed at the quality of the pictures.  The camera is a little bulky, but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: terrific camera!
Reviews.Author: kakie
Reviews.Content: A friend of my son who has all the latest toys has the previous model, and recommnended this strongly to my son. I bought it for a b-day gift. My son is a surfer and downhill skier, and this fits the outdoor-rugged-water-temperature bill. Takes good photos.  It did not come with a memory card, which I did not know until I received the package.  The description did not mention it; I assumed it would come with a at least a starter card.  Still, a good price for a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Not even water resistant
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: I looked at a number of options before choosing.  I was attracted by the waterproof depth rating as well as the HD Video.  The camera was hardly used since the initial purchase months ago. I bought it so that my daughter could take pics while snorkeling in the shallows. On its first outing, both seals failed completely. The camera was never more than six inches under and within an hour, the lens began fogging up and that was it.  The unit is full of salt water.ProsGood picture quality and excellent HD video.ConsNot waterproof at all.  Probably water resistant....light rainfall at best.

Reviews.Title: Everything is Proprietary!
Reviews.Author: Markus Demitrius
Reviews.Content: The camera does not allow you to import movies to your computer unless you use their supplied editing software.  Once the movies are in your computer you STILL cannot use your favorite editing programs.  You can only use Panasonic's supplied editing software (PhotoFunStudio), which is FILLED with disclaimers about how it may not work properly.ALL movies made on this camera, both standard or hi-def, are not even recognized by Windows Movie Maker!  This would be OK if the supplied editing software was usable, but its editing functions are limited to deleting select portions of the movie - that's it!  And it ONLY edits movies made by the camera, so forget about mixing your new movies with anything you already have.  The software manual has plenty of pretty pictures and seems strait-forward, until you read deeper - plenty of pages of instructions on how to 'register' things, but not one single sentence about what 'registering' means, what it does, or WHY you would register something.  I've an IQ of 151, read the manual twice and still don't have a clue.The USB cable is proprietary, so you might as well order a new one right away because you won't be able to replace it unless you order another from Panasonic - ANOTHER specialty cable to lag around, as if I don't have enough already!PANASONIC - If you're going to limit us to using only your editing software, then at least provide something with more than BASIC editing functions!  Something that doesn't have dozens of 'may-not-work' disclaimers!  Something that works with regular movies!I don't care how waterproof/shockproof it is or how great the movies/pics turn out - if I can't do anything with the movies or mix them with my old stuff, just what good are they?PANASONIC - there are things in the electronics community known as STANDARDS.  It allows different brand named products to work well with each other.  You know - communicate, share files, things like that.  Do you think people who buy your products live in a 'Panasonic Bubble' and isolate themselves from all other brands?  You certainly designed this camera that way!Do NOT buy this camera unless you plan on spending a lot of time learning yet another editing program that is basically useless!  Unless you want to take pics ONLY!  Unless you enjoy throwing money away!If this is how Panasonic designs their products then I recommend you not spend your money on ANYTHING Panasonic unless you enjoy limiting yourself.  Their specifications can be the very best, but if you can't DO anything with the finished product then what good is it?IMHO...

Reviews.Title: Happy experience
Reviews.Author: Zac
Reviews.Content: The image quality is satisfactory; however, the camera didn't come with a proper camera bag or a lens cover. Even though it's a pocket-size camera, I cannot put it into my pocket as I'm afraid of scratching the lens.Panasonic people need to consider the problems with more empathy.

Reviews.Title: Great pics in the water
Reviews.Author: China Mary "China Mary"
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is excellent. Taken it to many snorkeling and beach/pool trips. The underwater photos are great. Don't forget to white balance even underwater. Don't forget to rinse after the beach or pool. I think that because I didn't, there is a very tough water drop stain on the lens window. I've tried everything to clean it off and it won't come off. The video quality is great too. I dropped it down to 4 stars because of the annoying and ugly rubber covering. The Pentax waterproof cameras look like they're built to handle drops because it's so rubbery to begin with...the Lumix is tough, but you have to keep adding this rubber condom around it for the shock absorption. So then if I forget to take my camera out of my beach bag, it gets nasty with the water stuck in between the camera and the condom.

Reviews.Title: I've had it for 3+ years!
Reviews.Author: Shawn Gillas
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the best camera I have ever bought.  It takes great pictures.  It takes great video.  The special effect presets are awesome and work with video, which few point and shoots do.  It is as rugged as it is made out to be and then some.  It survived a white water canoeing accident.  It made it through dust storms in a high sierra desert (Burning Man).  It bounced off a hard wood floor from a 10' drop.  I can not be more happy with it.Be sure to get extra batteries.  It is small, so the battery is too.  I take a lot of pics and video in a day.  The battery does not last as long as the 32GB card does, obviously.  I got the silicon sleeve for it also and put it on immediately.  I am sure that helped with the drops.If this ever dies, I will go for what ever is the next in line in the TS series.  I hope when that day comes, the line is still around.  I don't see needing replaced soon.

Reviews.Title: excellent photo and video quality, but body corrodes badly
Reviews.Author: Cathy Hartland
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera for about 2 years, for use while sea kayaking and skiing. I rinse it after use as per manufacturer's instructions, and use the provided brush to clean off gaskets and lid edges. However, after about a year I began to notice corrosion on the body, and after 2 years the lcd display has been compromised by intrusion of water. The camera will still shoot photos but I can't see the display. I have heard about this issue from many others who have bought the camera for saltwater use; in fact, I was warned by a friend before I bought it, but I gave it a try anyway. No matter how well it is taken care of, the aluminum casing will corrode and fail in salt water. It's a pity - it takes great video and beautiful photos. But it has to be considered a disposable camera in saltwater environments. I won't be buying another.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk... Do not buy this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mickey Lover
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera knowing it was Panasonic brand. All my home electronics are made by Panasonic because I am very happy with it.After 14 months of purchasing this camera, for no reason at all it has stopped working. I thought it was the battery and at the airport I purchased a new battery that cost me $35.00 dollars. The camera still not working and I just wasted the money buying the new battery. It ruins my vacations for not having any pictures souviners.DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Good camera very very poor customer srevice
Reviews.Author: Chucker
Reviews.Content: I purchased this great little underwater camera, it takes good pictures and is easy to use.  After about 6 months the viewer quit working, all the numbers etc. that come on with the camera all work but you can't see what you are taking a picture of and it will not take a picture.  I sent it back under warranty, they kept it for several months then sent it back.  It still did not work, it had the same problem, so I sent it back again (each time cost me about $10 including insurance) and months later they sent it back to me again, still not working, same problem!  I called and talked to someone at Panasonic service, they said nothing was wrong with the camera (except it did not take pictures). I asked to talk to a manager, I was put on hold over 20 minutes, someone came on and asked if I still wanted to hold, I said yes, I was again on hold almost 40 minutes this time then cut off. . . dial tone!  So, I called someone at Panasonic corp. and left a message to please call me and give me a phone number of whom to call about getting it fixed.  I have never had anyone from Panasonic ever follow up with me.After owning many Panasonic camera's I have determined we as customers just are not worth even talking to and I will never buy another Panasonic product again and will share my story with anyone who will listen.If anyone has a good idea how to reach anyone who cares about customers please let me know.Chucker

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: 2001silverado
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! Have had it for a year this Christmas. Has been down to 20feet while snorkeling and had no problems with fogging or water leakage! My wife breaks everything and has yet to break this thing! Been to Jamaica, Grand Turk, and Nassau and is still going strong! Would give more stars if possible!

Reviews.Title: Excelent Product
Reviews.Author: Maurinel
Reviews.Content: Excelent Product...excelent pictures under water..I recomend this  product if you are looking for a camera under water and also for normal use.

Reviews.Title: I've had great luck so far with this camera.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Jones
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since March and I've used it in two settings where the waterproof feature was necessary.  First was a trip to Mexico where the camera withstood sand and splashes.  The big test though was the white water rafting trip we just returned from.  Our raft flipped and the camera was strapped to my boyfriend's wrist.  After traveling two miles under water, (under very COLD water) the camera is still working perfectly!  I've taken great care to ensure the seal is very clean each time I close it and I always use the silicone housing that came with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good For Intended Use
Reviews.Author: Rex G. Kemp "Desert Ghost"
Reviews.Content: While this camera would not replace my dedicated video camera or my digital SLR, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS2 did a credible job in situations where I would not take a more expensive camera. Still shots were more than adequate. Sound pick up was surprisenly good. Video was good when one can be stationary. We attempted to use the camera while zip lining and it often had difficulty focusing at 40-50 mph. Underwater shots were very good, both video and still shots. I wish the optical zoom had a higher range, but it is OK. The PDF manual is extensive, but takes time to understand this rather complex camera with all of its capabilities.The supplied software was adequate for downloading and a simple slide show, but not for editing. I would use an alternative editing software such as Photohop Elements or similar.Purchase of an SD card is essential. A reasonable size SD card will provide a lot of room many pictures and videos. The battery life is OK, but if you are not in position to recharge daily, a second battery would be prudent.

Reviews.Title: not water proof!
Reviews.Author: Paulo Alves
Reviews.Content: On  August 27 2010,  I bought a Lumix DMC-TS2 14.1 MP camera on Amazon.com. At the very first time when I used  it underwater and the day after, in spite of all appropriate care, it presented the lens visor smoked and stopped working . I live in Rio, Brazil.  At the local  Panasonic  technical support  they told me that it would be too expensive to fix the camera here. I need to send  it to the USA for repairing.

Reviews.Title: best all purpose pocket camera
Reviews.Author: V. Calvin Hoe
Reviews.Content: I loved the compact, sealed unit.  I bought this camera for use on my job as wind technician for wind turbines.  I work in all weather conditions from dusty days to sub-freezing.  This camera has not failed me yet.Update: Panasonic has a firmware update for the flash issued June 28, 2010 that you can download from Panasonic.com.

Reviews.Title: Best waterproof camera currently on the market.
Reviews.Author: skd0120
Reviews.Content: I am a whitewater kayaker and was looking for a quality waterproof camera that actually took good photos.  This is it.  I love the picture quality.  The pictures my buddies take with the Olympus or the Pentax don't compare to the Lumix.  The colors are bright and clear.  The camera has built in image stabilization which help a lot when trying to shoot from my boat.  I love the rapid fire option on this camera as well as the ability to shoot high definition video.  All around, this is a great camera for use on and off the water.  It seems to be well designed and comes with substantial care instructions to maintain the waterproofness.  It also comes with a protective silicone cover.  I carry this camera with me most everywhere.  When I paddle, I have it attached to my PFD.  It has been substantially saturated in water many times without issue.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!!!!
Reviews.Author: T. Wheeler "Golf Nut & Coffee Lover"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera! It takes great pictures, is very well made and is extremely easy to use. The battery holds a good charge and I can take hundreds of pictures before I have to re-charge it. I work for a construction company and the camera's durability, minimal number of moving parts and the fact that it is shock resistant and waterproof make it the perfect fit for our company's field operations.

Reviews.Title: Everyday-use sort of camera
Reviews.Author: J. Kent
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an everyday-use sort of camera. I've been using it for a while and it isn't perfect, but it does an okay job for most things.The main failing of this camera has to be its poor low-light performance. I'm by no means a photographic expert, but the small lens and sensor combined are the likely culprits. This problem is exacerbated somewhat by the relatively small built in flash.The other major quality gripe I have is the resolution. The optics of this camera are not even close to resolving 14 MP. Zoom in on any pic from this camera, and you will see blur long before you see pixels. Think of this camera as closer to 8MP maybe, or less even.Beyond the quality issues the functionality of this camera is great. The 5x optical zoom is plenty for a pocket camera like this, and zooming during video is nice.The camera boots up in about a second, and can take pretty quick shots; this makes it great catching unexpected pictures. Plus, there is no telescoping lens or lens cap to wait far. It is literally 3 seconds between having the camera in your pocket and taking a picture.Being water proof and rugged is a major plus. I've taken lots of underwater shots with it; there is less light available underwater, which can be an issue, but otherwise it works great.This camera does a good job of being there when you need it, and getting the shot you want in time. I recommend it on these attributes; if that isn't what you need there are cheaper cameras with better quality.

Reviews.Title: Facil manejo y entrega inmediata
Reviews.Author: Erna González
Reviews.Content: Excelente camara! pecado ningun Tipo de Quejas. Me Llego Tal Cual Como he aquí describen en El Anuncio. Muy Sencilla de utilizar. La recomiendo ampliamente. Vendedor al Incluido.

Reviews.Title: So far ..... very nice!!
Reviews.Author: Roberto
Reviews.Content: I have been using the camera for two weeks. I am satisfied with the image quality. Fast shutter speed, a great improvement from the Olympus I had before. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: hend
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for my daughter because she wanted a water proof camera.  After doing my research, this camera seemed to have the best features.  I have to admit, I am totally impressed!  Fabulous pictures in both the water and out.  This camera has reached way beyond my expectations and I am not a beginner.  I think I am buying one for myself and my brother is also purchasing one (he has another water camera which is only 8 months old).

Reviews.Title: Lumix camera
Reviews.Author: Joanne
Reviews.Content: So far I'm happy with my new Lumix. I use it for quick snapshots and haven't explored any of the fancier features yet. My last camera got wet and died and I wanted the rugged-ness of the Lumix in case of accidents (also my six year old likes to take pictures and I feel more secure about its features.)

Reviews.Title: Excellent all-purpose camera
Reviews.Author: E. Su "drerwinsu"
Reviews.Content: Pros:Ease of use, many built in programs for various types of photos, good face recognition focusing.Excellent pictures and moviesCons:None really.I had an Olympus waterproof camera for 5 years until its seals failed (it was also a great camera).  I had tried various permutations of disposable waterproof cameras and a case for a cheap digital camera that I bought on eBay.  A good, brand name waterproof camera is the way to go.I opted for this Panasonic based on other positive reviews and I have not been disappointed.  It has many features that other point and shoot cameras have.  I love having the versatility of a water and land camera that fits in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Best underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Ra
Reviews.Content: I bought this before going to Caribbean. Pictures taken by this camera are absolutely gorgeous, compared to my other two cameras (Fuji and Sony). Underwater pictures are also fantastic. The only problem is that the quality of pictures are not good with low light, which I think it is the problem with almost all point and shoot camera. I returned the first one since there was water leaking into battery chamber but the second unit works great. I bought this despite knowing that the Lumix TS3 is coming out because the price is much cheaper (aroun 250$ on amazon) and there is not much improvement with new generation. Also I think this TS2 is a little bit thinner, compared to TS3. I never feel regret buying this one at all.

Reviews.Title: Travel Cam
Reviews.Author: MR
Reviews.Content: Bought this as my travel camera and it has done good so far. A few of my pictures have come out slightly over exposed but overall picture quality is good for tough point and shoot.  Lots of options on this camera, favorite for artsy shots is the pin hole setting.

Reviews.Title: Great Vacation Camera
Reviews.Author: khanman
Reviews.Content: For the longest time i have simply relied on my phone for picture taking as i am not much of a shutter bug. Decided to buy a camera after starting scuba diving... the features, battery life and all on this are extremely good for the price i paid. Used along with the scuba case, haven't tested the rugged features of the camera itself however, nice to know they are there.

Reviews.Title: 1 krankyguy
Reviews.Author: frank a perrone
Reviews.Content: love this liitle camera, bought specificaly for snorkeling/scuba diving no complaints, works fine out of water also. this my second panasonic camera. leica lenses are phenominal, software works great reliable  durable easy to use cameras

Reviews.Title: Great, little waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After tons of research on waterproof digital cameras, decided to take a chance on this one. We were planning a trip to Playa del Carmen, MX and I needed a camera for the pool and gulf. Was not disappointed. Had the camera under waterfalls, on an excursion in a cenote, in the pool, and the Gulf of Mexico. All the videos and stills turned out great. The vivid and happy settings for exposure really enhanced the pics and video so that you feel like you're there. Would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Made Hawaii more fun
Reviews.Author: Jessica Andersen "IA book lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our trip to Hawaii. I wanted to be able to take it on the boat when we went out snorkeling. We got some great shots of the kids snorkeling and I got a fabulous shot of a spinner dolphin. We also took pictures of the kids in the pool at the resort. It was nice to have a camera to take and not worry that it would get splashed or get sand in it at the beach. I didn't have any trouble with the camera leaking. I was careful to only open it to change the battery or copy pictures when I was safely back in the hotel room. This camera was taken down maybe 10 feet or so while out snorkeling. I was pleased with the picture quality. I would highly recommend this camera for worry free vacation use. The kids also had a great time using this camera in the pool to take pictures of each other under the water.The only real negative I had with this camera is that it was almost impossible to see the LCD screen while under water in the daytime. And, since it doesn't have a different viewfinder, it was a little bit of point the camera and hope it was capturing what I wanted. However, as long as I wasn't trying to zoom in on an object, the pictures all came out really well. I think with more practice I will be able to zoom in also.As a side note, I also ordered an orange floating wriststrap for the camera. I wanted it to float in case dropped overboard or in the pool. Olympus STRAP FLOAT ORANGE

Reviews.Title: Great Rugged Camera
Reviews.Author: Manuel Freitas
Reviews.Content: Was impressed with the picture and video quality.  Took it out in the saltwater at Ala Moana beach park in Honolulu, HI and it worked great.

Reviews.Title: last of made in japan
Reviews.Author: wow
Reviews.Content: Great piece of equipment.  Solid.  Maybe the last of Made in Japan camera.Lost the first one at Expo in Shanghai last year.  Had to buy another one.Just bought  the third one.

Reviews.Title: Positive
Reviews.Author: StompedFilms
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use and takes great photos and HD videos (even in very cold Winter conditions) - recommended.

Reviews.Title: wish it would have worked
Reviews.Author: rrocket
Reviews.Content: Loved this camera. Worked perfect for 5 days.Great underwater footage. No leaks.End of day 5 it started saying the battery door was openwhen it wasn't. Only took a few pictures after that anddoor warning stayed on and couldn't take any more shots.Had to send back. Want a working one. Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent so far!
Reviews.Author: sapphire
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a few weeks however it has been amazing! I used it in the desert and in the snow and so far the pictures have been nice, the camera easy to use and the settings available are great. I can't wait to use it underwater!

Reviews.Title: So far so good...
Reviews.Author: Marianne
Reviews.Content: I'm by no means a camera expert, I've been using this camera for a couple months now, I originally purchased it for a trip to Florida, and have since used it in snow and as a general camera. The camera held up perfectly well on the beach and in the snow (although it never needed to be submerged) and all of the pictures have come out great. The only thing that slightly annoys me (so far) is there can be a slight delay when using the auto-focus so sometimes I don't get the shot I had intended. and when I take video, it can only be held in one direction (or the video comes out sideways). However, as those are both fairly common occurances with other digital cameras I have owned in the past, it isn't actually worth reducing the rating. Overall, I'm so far quite pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT DEAL
Reviews.Author: Javier
Reviews.Content: For what I could study so far, it's a great item and I'm glad for having purchased it. If you want a pocket cam with professional functions this is de deal your are looking for.It's worth every cent and more.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: J. Mark "Magic Marker"
Reviews.Content: The camera only saw a little time in the water, but it was sea water.  I did rinse it off in clean water before opening any of the seals.  I actually clipped the camera onto my chest while we were zip lining and did some video recording.  Once I get a chance to download the content, I'll update the review.Edit/ about 6 months from original review.Well, we only used it for our cruise.  It worked really well and the HD recording was excellent during daylight hours.  I never had a need/ chance to use it in darker situations.  Overall, very happy with this purchase and it feels much more substantial than the Olympus waterproof camera we bought over a year ago.  That camera is now in the car in case I ever need it for an emergency.

Reviews.Title: Target acquired
Reviews.Author: E.Albayrak
Reviews.Content: This perfect small camera takes not only great underwater photos but also sound outdoor photos. It is useful, easy to setup and portable. Blue color gives catchy look :)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: rramirez
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and shoots awesome video. Easy to carry around and not worry about getting it get damaged by water. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Novice
Reviews.Author: Meredith L. Rivers
Reviews.Content: This camera is great & SUPER user friendly!  I didn't have time to immediately read the booklet but was able to figure everything out that I needed for the first night. I have a Nikon SLR but wanted something small enough to throw in my purse.  This camera is awesome and came recommended by our friends who have also enjoyed it.  The quality of the picture is crisp and clear.  I am impressed with the Panasonic Lumix.  :-)

Reviews.Title: Amazing water pics
Reviews.Author: mom
Reviews.Content: very impress with my outdoor and by the pool shots. Not so impress when flash is needed. Overall pics are clear, I had an old olympus water proof oen that we broke by leaving in the heat. I would say the pic quality her is better. The camera is a lot thicker and heavier than the Olympus tough

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: G. Preston
Reviews.Content: We find this to be a fun camera to have around. It pretty much does everything they say. We have had it underwater twice and around the water (tubing) and have not had any problems.This case - Tamrac 3814 Neo's Digital 14 Camera Case - fits it like it was made for it. A must have if you get one of these cameras. If the price doesn't scare you away the you should be quite happy with how this camera does. As for the video you can look online and get a free converter. I found Free HD Converter, it does great job although the camera software will also do it. At this point I am not sure which one is the best to use. One thing you have to remember and it goes for all waterproof cameras is that if you get water droplets on the lens or dried salt spots it will affect the picture. A floating strap is also a must have IMHO. It will record over 2 hours of video on a 16 gig SDHD card. So far I am very glad that we got this camera.

Reviews.Title: Get this camera!!
Reviews.Author: lutheranliar
Reviews.Content: This camera will change your life!No longer will you have to worry about splashing by the pool, salt spray by the ocean, lapping at the lake.It is, as billed, completely waterproof.I also own a teensy Canon, which is good for slipping into pockets and purses and such.And a Flip video, which is good because it stays charged for an hour.But.When I'm anywhere near water, this is the one I use.Now the ongoing documentary that is my life has no gaps.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Gustavo
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed with this camera.  I really thought Panasonic would do a better job designing and building a product with these features.  Camera is large and heavy and picture quality isn't very good, which is what I expected, but I bought it since it was supposedly waterproof.  Well, it isn't.  First trip with this camera, second day on the pool and it stopped working. I did absolutely everything the manual instructed but water got inside anyways.  Problem seems to be a leakage from the picture mode dial, so it shouldn't be my fault.  This is really a second or third camera for most people since it is heavy and doesn't take stunning pictures so it will never be your number one camera if you favor size (good compact will be your choice) or image quality (SLR will be the one picked).  The reason to get this, and really why I bought it, was for its waterproof feature.  Since waterproof is a misstatement, takes away the reason for owning it.  I strongly recommend anyone thinking about this to avoid it at all cost, unless you typically drop your electronic products.  I haven't dropped it either to be sure the toughness as described in the product overview is accurate, but to be honest from the feel of the camera and from its weight I really don't believe it will resist a 2 meter drop.  This is the first time in many years I have a problem with a brand new tech product.  Won't be buying Panasonic products anymore.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic LumixDMC-TS2
Reviews.Author: Paul Jobe
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with this product.The PC software is very intuitive and versatile to the point that we use it to manage all of our other photos/videos.It's has a very bright light for night photos and takes incredible movies to the point where our olderlaptop can't keep up with it's high resolution playback. The PC software will test your hardware and optimizeit's settings to allow for frame skips. The camera has many features in which we use the "hand shaking" (handledat the physical lens level - not in software) and moving image tracking.We ended buying a 32GB card to keep up with the disk space the photos/movies will take (photos ~14MB a shot).We also bought an extra battery but haven't really use it much.I highly recommend this camera but our experience is pretty low in photography. We have an older Canon thattakes similar photos but does not shoot movies in High Definition.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Disappointed!!!!
Reviews.Author: Murth "themurth"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the HD video capabilities but after video taping several important events, I cannot open the files in my video editing program.  It appears Panasonic will not allow it.  I am now scrambling to find a video converter software program that will allow me to convert the files.  This is poor on Panasonic's part and feel like I have been ripped off.  I will never buy a Panasonic product again!

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing and dead after 1 year of very mild use
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: This started off as a decent camera until it was used for what it was designed for, underwater shots.  One month after the very short 1-year warranty expired it is now dead.  The camera was only used at a depth of about 1 foot from a canoe for a few minutes total.  Before placing the camera in water, I was very cautious and checked the battery door for dirt and debris and then closed it and locked it.  With the short amount of time and shallow depth this camera was underwater, I can't imaging how it would have worked it if had been for longer or to a deeper depth for snorkeling, etc.I assumed that since Panasonic makes many "TOUGH" products they would be the best brand to buy, but I guess I was wrong it is now going to cost $172 for them to attempt to repair it through Panasonic.Honestly, I expected much better.

Reviews.Title: Great Video, Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: carolyn williams
Reviews.Content: After looking at all of the reviews, it was a toss-up between this camera and the Canon.  I went with the Lumix because of the size, and I was not disappointed. We took it with us on a trip to Costa Rica and really put it through everything.  We took it on boat trips, snorkelled with it, took video while being buffeted and splashed on a Wave Runner riding around the coast, took pics of surfers while in the water with waves crashing on top of us and used it on the beach during windy sandy conditions.  The snorkeling pictures were not great, so I decided to put it in video mode instead, and WOW!  The underwater video is fantastic.  I realize now it is much easier to capture the magic of what you are seeing underwater with video than with still pics (it is almost impossible to get those fish to cooperate). The day was cloudy, and the underwater video actually looks brighter than it was.  Video out of the water was great, too.  I have National Geographic quality video of the Howler Monkeys that visited us in the trees where we were staying.  And the out-of-water pictures are great, too - no disappointments there.  I am not a very knowledgeable photographer, just use the auto settings. I rarely needed any flash, the camera takes great pics in low light.  A note about the silicone case that comes with the camera, I read in many other reviews that the users didn't bother with it, but I loved it.  Once on, it protects the camera from getting all scratched up, buffers it a bit if you drop it, but most importantly, it makes it impossible for you to accidentally open the battery or card access while underwater.  That is the only weak point in the system - I can see how the latches for those access compartments could be nudged into the unlocked position if you weren't paying attention. Not possible with the cover on.  So, so far no complaints about this camera.  Now the only problem I have is which camera to use out-of-water, since I still love my old Dimage, too.

Reviews.Title: worked well for a while
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Chet Brewer"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Panasonic after trashing a good Canon camera while kayaking last summer. It held up kayaking and snorkeling in the Caribbean at thanksgiving. Then on a snorkeling trip at Christmas in the Caribbean it gave up the ghost the third time under water on this trip. About 30 minutes into the trip the screen fuzzed up and the camera started buzzing. I got it out of the water and soaked it in tap water for 30 minutes. When I opened it it was full of water. My best guess is that a seal let loose because I was very careful to keep the o-rings clean each time I removed the SIM Card to download pictures.Generally I was pretty careful with it and did not take it any deeper then 6-8 feet. I was generally please with the camera performance, i got some nice sunset pictures and some really nice underwater pictures but a bit distressed that the camera seals let loose after 8 times in the water.So based on a sample size of one the durability is suspect.

Reviews.Title: waterproof...NOT!
Reviews.Author: JORDAN D. CORPUZ
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to talked about the ease of use, battery life, picture quality, portability, software and others.  This camera choked after less than 15 minutes under water.  This is my second digital waterproof camera.  The first one choked underwater while vacationing so I know how critical to take cautious manner in handling an expensive, delicate piece of equipment but to no avail, it failed. Just beware!

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: TI Ted
Reviews.Content: I have over 35 years as a professional photographer. I am happy with the photos I took with this camera prior to going in the water the first time. While snorkeling in Maui with the camera not even 3 feet deep it took five photos and died. First it said to turn the camera off and on again. Then I got an error message and the screen went black. When I got back to the villa and open the battery compartment it had water in it. I would recommend a water proof case because this camera needs to go back to the drawing board for a better design.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy with Panasonic Luimix DMC-TS2
Reviews.Author: MJR
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 of these camera's based on Specifications. Shame on me. Shame on Panasonic! Faster start up reads the specs, HD video reads the specs. Lies on both accounts. Start up entails pushing the power button, then waiting for a warning to fill the screen, "do you want to read the warning notice, Yes or No" Then hit the left arrow to select yes or no, then hit enter to confirm. Now if you have followed each of these steps correctly, you may be able to use your camera. Each and EVERY time you power on the camera, even if it went of due to power save, you will have to repeat these steps. For more fun switch to a picture mode, and receive even more warnings before you can proceed. I do not consider this a fast start up.As for HD, Panasonic uses AVCHD Lite format. They include PhotoFunHouse, a limited and very poorly written software to handle the AVCHD lite format. (It does not. It does not download any AVCHD movies if there is more than one movie on the memory card. It does not download the video and photos to any remote network drive, or other drive that is not the "program drive" It does convert to MP4 format if you can get it to recognize the movie on the camera at all.All in all, I am looking to dump 3 of camera's as soon as possible. Panasonic you can have the best specs around, but you drop the ball on using the camera and getting the photos / movies off the camera, and all other specs are worthless. DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA

ProductInfo.Features:
Advanced Tough Design
AVCHD Lite HD Movie Recording
It lets you shoot actively while moving around with the camera in one hand.
It features almost double the recording time in HD quality compared with the conventional Motion JPEG format.
A convenient auto function also automatically turns on the LED when the ambient light becomes dim.
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS2 14.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 4.6x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue)
